intro: Acronia constricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny seed pods. Acronia constricta is known for its ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators, including butterflies and bees.
